Module WGUScheduler
Package com.example.wgusoftware2scheduler.Utility

Class JDBC

java.lang.Object
com.example.wgusoftware2scheduler.Utility.JDBC
public class JDBC extends Object
JDBC class provides a singleton instance of a database connection, making it easier to reuse the connection for multiple purposes. The class uses the MySQL JDBC driver to connect to a database and perform various operations like authentication, fetching customer and appointment information, adding, updating, and deleting customers, etc.

    • addCustomer

      public static int addCustomer(String name, String address, String postalCode, String phone, int divisionId)
      Adds a new customer to the database.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the customer to add
      address - the address of the customer to add
      postalCode - the postal code of the customer to add
      phone - the phone number of the customer to add
      divisionId - the division ID of the customer to add
      Returns:
      the number of rows affected by the INSERT statement, typically 1

    • updateCustomer

      public static int updateCustomer(int id, String name, String address, String postalCode, String phone, int divisionId)
      Updates the customer with the given id in the database with the new name, address, postal code, phone, and divisionId.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the customer to be updated.
      name - The new name of the customer.
      address - The new address of the customer.
      postalCode - The new postal code of the customer.
      phone - The new phone of the customer.
      divisionId - The new division id of the customer.
      Returns:
      The number of rows affected by the update statement.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      an integer indicating the number of rows affected by the update operation

      description - Description of the appointment
      location - Location of the appointment
      type - Type of the appointment
      start - Start time of the appointment
      end - End time of the appointment
      customerId - ID of the customer associated with the appointment
      userId - ID of the user associated with the appointment
      contact - ID of the contact associated with the appointment
      Returns:
      the number of rows affected by the execution of the SQL statement

    • hourlyVolumeReport

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<HourlyVolumeReport> hourlyVolumeReport()
      Retrieves a list of HourlyVolumeReport objects from the database. The HourlyVolumeReport objects contain information about the time of day, the number of appointments, and the average appointment duration (in minutes) for each hour. The information is obtained by executing a SQL query that groups the appointments by hour and calculates the number of appointments and average appointment duration.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList of HourlyVolumeReport objects, each representing the data for a specific hour.
